intro: Bidens campylotheca f. filicifolia, commonly known as the fern-leaved beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its fern-like leaves, which are deeply lobed and give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to parts of the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, shaded environments. This species is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
